clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Used as a muscle relaxant during anesthesia and surgical procedures

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Pancuronium is a non depolarising muscle relaxant similar to curare It acts as a competitive acetylcholine antagonist on neuromuscular junctions displacing acetylcholine hence competitive from its post synaptic nicotinic acetylcholine receptors It is unlike suxamethonium a non depolarising agent which means that it causes no spontaneous depolarisations upon association with the nicotinic receptor in neuromuscular junction thus producing no muscle fasciculations upon administration Pancuronium has no hormonal activity It exerts slight vagolytic activity i e diminishing activity of the vagus nerve and no ganglioplegic i e blocking ganglions activity
